common_issues.title: Ollama installation fails on Pieces for Linux
common_issues.description: Pieces users on Linux are experiencing issues installing and using Ollama for local model inference. This is primarily due to Snap environment sandboxing restrictions. Proposed solutions involve adapting Pieces to work within these limitations and bundling necessary dependencies. A fix is expected soon.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Title:** Ollama fails to install in snap environment

**Key points:**

* Ollama installation fails for Pieces-OS users on Ubuntu who use the Snap package.
* This is due to the Snap environment sandboxing curl and other dependencies needed by Ollama.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces-OS initially incorrectly assumed curl was not installed.
* The snap confinement restrictions prevent Ollama from accessing necessary executables.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Add curl and other dependencies to the Snap package definition file.
* Adapt Pieces-OS to operate within the Snap environment's limitations.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Fix in development, expected in the next week (as of January 23, 2025).

**Additional notes:**

* The issue also affects inference, not just downloading.
* Manual download of LLM models is not a viable workaround.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f50f1e1d-4eb2-46a2-9df7-2892ea6d319b)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Raju-git20 is facing issues connecting to PiecesOS after the migration to a new port.
* The new port is 39300.
* Raju-git20 provided screenshots of the error messages.
* Raju-git20's project involves scraping LinkedIn positions and applying to them using AI.

**Problems identified:**

* Raju-git20's code was unable to connect to PiecesOS using the new port.
* The port-finding algorithm in PiecesOS may not be working correctly.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces provided information about the port-finding algorithm and its range.
* Mark-at-pieces offered to schedule a call to discuss Raju-git20's project and provide further assistance.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Raju-git20 and Mark-at-pieces are scheduled to have a call to discuss the issue further.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation took place between January 24th and 28th, 2025.
* The conversation involved Raju-git20, the pieces-support-bot, and mark-at-pieces.

## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS Update Failure (Issue #619)

**Key points raised:**

* User experiencing failure to update PiecesOS on their Pieces Desktop app. 
* This occurred after installing both Pieces and PiecesOS from the Microsoft Store.

**Problems identified:**

* Microsoft Store installation does not support in-app updates. 
* Confusing user experience surrounding updating, particularly for Microsoft Store builds.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Two temporary workarounds identified:
    * Reopening PiecesOS & Desktop App.
    * Manually updating applications via the Microsoft Store.
* Team will improve user experience during Microsoft Store updates in the future.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue closed with the workarounds provided.
* Future updates aim to address this challenge and provide a clearer update process for Microsoft Store builds.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Issue Summary for GitHub Issue #590

**Key Points:**

* Issue reported by user ThemePark on 2025-01-17 about Pieces Desktop App not launching on Windows 10.
* ThemePark confirmed having Pieces Suite, OS, and Desktop installed.
* Mack Myers, a Pieces support team member, suspected a timing conflict between PiecesOS updating and the Desktop App launching on startup.
* ThemePark confirmed having PiecesOS set to launch on startup.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces Desktop App not launching on Windows 10.
* Potential timing conflict between PiecesOS update and Desktop App launch on startup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack Myers suggested switching the startup app to Pieces Desktop instead of PiecesOS.
* Alternatively, not running either app at startup was also proposed.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* ThemePark has yet to provide feedback on the proposed solutions.
* Issue remains open as of February 14, 2023.

**Additional Notes:**

* User Andy Schubert provided their contact information in the comments.
* This summary only covers the information available in the provided conversation.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Ollama installation issues on Linux:** This recurring issue is causing frustration for users and generating significant support volume. Focus on addressing the root cause, such as Snap environment limitations, and provide clear guidance to affected users.

**Improve Pieces Copilot service and model installation:** Investigate and address issues related to Copilot model saving, service accessibility, and Ollama integration. Ensure seamless installation and functionality across different operating systems.

**Address Pieces OS connection and launch issues:** Investigate and resolve connection errors (ECONNREFUSED, Route not found) users are encountering, particularly after port changes. Provide clear instructions on verifying port numbers and troubleshooting connection problems.

**Enhance PiecesOS Early Access Program onboarding and update process:** Provide clear and detailed instructions for installing, updating, and launching the Early Access Program, specifically addressing issues related to Microsoft Store installations and potential conflicts with the Desktop App.

**Improve communication and transparency around known issues:** Proactively communicate known issues, such as those related to PiecesOS updates and Desktop App launches, to users. Provide updates on the progress of fixes and workarounds to manage user expectations.

**Consider creating a dedicated troubleshooting guide for common issues:** Develop a comprehensive troubleshooting guide addressing common issues like Ollama installation, Copilot service problems, and connection errors. This will empower users to resolve issues independently and reduce support ticket volume.

**Gather user feedback on PiecesOS performance and accuracy:** Address user concerns regarding PiecesOS performance and accuracy compared to alternatives like ChatGPT. Investigate optimization opportunities and communicate improvements to users.

**Monitor and analyze support ticket trends:** Continuously monitor and analyze support ticket data to identify recurring issues, emerging trends, and areas for improvement in the product or support processes. Use this data to proactively address issues and enhance the user experience.
